data.title: Sharing Sweden
data.meta_description: In 1975, a group of very different individuals lived in a commune called 'Together'. Now it is 1999, 24 years later, and they meet up again.
data.text:
Together 99 Log in and apply About the film In 1975, a group of idealists lived in a community called 'Together'. Now in 1999, 'Together' is in a new house and has become the world’s smallest commune consisting of only two people - Göran and Klasse. Feeling a bit lonely, Klasse decides to surprise Göran with a reunion on his birthday, only to discover how much has changed over the years and begin to realize not everything in life goes quite as planned. Swedish filmmaker, Lukas Moodysson, assembles some familiar faces and others who feel completely foreign in this dark comedy. Contact person Emma Kalmevall and Agnes Lidbeck Subtitles Subtitles are available in English. The Swedish Institute will translate films into German, Spanish and French on demand. For other languages, you will need to include the costs for local translation in the budget of your application. Genre Drama/comedy Footnote Together 99 is the follow up to Moodysson´s Together. The film was praised by both audiences and critics and was a box-office hit in a number of countries. Two decades later the ensemble from Together is reunited. Content included Film trailer Film facts Original title: Tillsammans 99 Director: Lukas Moodysson Director’s biography: Lukas Moodysson is a critically acclaimed film director and screenwriter who was born in 1969 in the south of Sweden. He is known for films such as Show me love (1998), Together (2000), Lilya 4-Ever (2002), A Hole In My Heart (2004), Container (2006), Mammoth (2009) and We are the Best! (2013), and HBO TV series Gösta (2019). Screenwriter: Lukas Moodysson With: Gustaf Hammarsten, Shanti Roney, Anja Lundqvist, Olle Sarri, Jessica Liedberg, Lisa Lindgren, Cecilia Frode, Lars Frode, Henrik Lundström, Sten Ljunggren, David Dencik, Jonas Karlsson, Julia Heveus, Clara Christiansson Drake Production: Lars Jönsson and Anna Carlsten for Memfis Film AB Age limit: suitable for 7 years or older Time: 115 min National release: 2023 How to apply If you represent a Swedish foreign mission you can apply for permission to screen films at local film events. The application is made via the SI Customer portal. When you make your application, you have the option to request financial support for the event. To preview full length films, get information about local rights, and access other protected content, you need to create an application, which you can then review and complete at a later date. Before making an application, it is mandatory to read the rules and conditions for the Swedish film selection. We will review your application and give you access to film material and information on how to preview the films. Once you have decided which film or films to screen, and have all the required information, you update and send in your application via the portal. \n

Sharingsweden.se uses cookies and other data in order to deliver and improve your experience of this website. For instance, we and our partners may use information about you, your devices and your online interactions with us to provide, analyse and improve our services.

\n

The categories of cookies that we may use are necessary as well as statistics and analytics cookies. Learn more about how we use cookies by reading our Cookie policy.

He is known for films such as Show me love (1998), Together (2000), Lilya 4-Ever (2002), A Hole In My Heart (2004), Container (2006), Mammoth (2009) and We are the Best! (2013), and HBO TV series Gösta (2019)." }, { "type": "paragraph", "anchorId": "", "children": "Screenwriter: Lukas Moodysson" }, { "type": "paragraph", "anchorId": "", "children": "With: Gustaf Hammarsten, Shanti Roney, Anja Lundqvist, Olle Sarri, Jessica Liedberg, Lisa Lindgren, Cecilia Frode, Lars Frode, Henrik Lundström, Sten Ljunggren, David Dencik, Jonas Karlsson, Julia Heveus, Clara Christiansson Drake" }, { "type": "paragraph", "anchorId": "", "children": "Production: Lars Jönsson and Anna Carlsten for Memfis Film AB" }, { "type": "paragraph", "anchorId": "", "children": "Age limit: suitable for 7 years or older" }, { "type": "paragraph", "anchorId": "", "children": "Time: 115 min" }, { "type": "paragraph", "anchorId": "", "children": "National release: 2023" } ] }, { "type": "section", "anchorId": "how-to-apply", "children": [ { "type": "heading", "anchorId": "", "h2": true, "children": "How to apply" }, { "type": "paragraph", "anchorId": "", "children": "If you represent a Swedish foreign mission you can apply for permission to screen films at local film events. The application is made via the SI Customer portal. When you make your application, you have the option to request financial support for the event." }, { "type": "paragraph", "anchorId": "", "children": "To preview full length films, get information about local rights, and access other protected content, you need to create an application, which you can then review and complete at a later date. Before making an application, it is mandatory to read the rules and conditions for the Swedish film selection." }, { "type": "paragraph", "anchorId": "", "children": "We will review your application and give you access to film material and information on how to preview the films." }, { "type": "paragraph", "anchorId": "", "children": "Once you have decided which film or films to screen, and have all the required information, you update and send in your application via the portal." }, { "type": "paragraph", "anchorId": "", "children": "Fill in an application – step" } ] } ], "fullWidth": "SharingSwedenTswPreambleBlockAttributes" }, "innerBlocks": [ { "name": "core/paragraph", "attributes": { "anchor": "", "content": "In 1975, a group of idealists lived in a community called 'Together'. Now in 1999, 'Together' is in a new house and has become the world’s smallest commune consisting of only two people - Göran and Klasse. Feeling a bit lonely, Klasse decides to surprise Göran with a reunion on his birthday, only to discover how much has changed over the years and begin to realize not everything in life goes quite as planned. Swedish filmmaker, Lukas Moodysson, assembles some familiar faces and others who feel completely foreign in this dark comedy.
